017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import java.util.Optional;
022
023import java.util.function.BiFunction;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
033import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
034
035/**
036 * A {@link DeterministicSupplier} with additional contractual
037 * requirements.
038 *
039 * <p><strong>An {@link OptionalSupplier} does not behave like an
040 * {@link Optional} or a {@link
041 * java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture},</strong> despite the
042 * deliberate similarities of some method names.</p>
043 *
044 * <p>An implementation of this interface is not a <a
045 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
046 * class</a>.</p>
047 *
048 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
049 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
050 *
051 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
052 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
053 *
054 * @see #deterministic()
055 *
056 * @see #get()
057 *
058 * @see #optional()
059 */
060@FunctionalInterface
061public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends DeterministicSupplier<T> {
062
063  /**
064   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
065   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
066   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
067   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
068   * that does occur, including {@link NoSuchElementException} and
069   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
070   * indicate value absence.
071   *
072   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
073   *
074   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
075   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
076   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
077   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
078   * that does occur
079   *
080   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
081   * null}
082   *
083   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
084   * return {@code null}
085   *
086   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
087   * determinism.
088   *
089   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
090   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads,
091   * but the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method of
092   * the supplied {@code handler} may not be.
093   *
094   * @see #get()
095   */
096  @OverridingDiscouraged
097  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
098    try {
099      return this.get();
100    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
101      try {
102        return handler.apply(e);
103      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
104        r.addSuppressed(e);
105        throw r;
106      }
107    }
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}.
112   *
113   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
114   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
115   *
116   * <ul>
117   *
118   * <li>It is deliberately and explicitly permitted for
119   * implementations of this method to return {@code null} for any
120   * reason.  Callers of this method must be appropriately
121   * prepared.</li>
122   *
123   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic
124   * (unless the {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method
125   * returns {@code true})</li>
126   *
127   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate the (possibly
128   * transitory) absence of a value by any of the following means:
129   *
130   * <ul>
131   *
132   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.</li>
133   *
134   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.  Normally
135   * such an implementation will also return {@code true} from its
136   * {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method.</li>
137   *
138   * </ul></li>
139   *
140   * </ul>
141   *
142   * @return a value, which may be {@code null}
143   *
144   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate (usually
145   * transitory) absence
146   *
147   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate (usually
148   * permanent) absence
149   *
150   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
151   * return {@code null}, even in the normal course of events.
152   *
153   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
154   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
155   *
156   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
157   * determinism.  An ideal implementation should be idempotent.  If
158   * the {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method returns
159   * {@code true}, then any implementation of this method must be
160   * deterministic.
161   *
162   * @see #deterministic()
163   */
164  @Override
165  public T get();
166
167  /**
168   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link
169   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
170   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
171   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
172   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
173   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
174   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
175   * instances that are used to indicate value absence.
176   *
177   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
178   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
179   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
180   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()} method,
181   * including {@link NoSuchElementException} and {@link
182   * UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
183   * indicate value absence.</p>
184   *
185   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
186   *
187   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
188   *
189   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
190   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
191   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
192   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
193   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
194   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
195   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
196   * instances that are used to indicate value absence
197   *
198   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
199   * null}
200   *
201   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
202   * return {@code null}.
203   *
204   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
205   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
206   *
207   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
208   * determinism.
209   *
210   * @see #get()
211   */
212  @OverridingDiscouraged
213  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
214    T value;
215    try {
216      value = this.get();
217    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
218      try {
219        return handler.apply(null, e);
220      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
221        r.addSuppressed(e);
222        throw r;
223      }
224    }
225    return handler.apply(value, null);
226  }
227
228  /**
229   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
230   * on the supplied {@code action} with the return value of an
231   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
232   * null}, unless the {@link #get()} method throws either a {@link
233   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
234   * UnsupportedOperationException}, indicating value absence, in
235   * which case no action is taken.
236   *
237   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
238   * take; must not be {@code null}
239   *
240   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
241   *
242   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
243   * determinism.
244   *
245   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
246   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
247   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
248   * accept(Object)} method may not be
249   *
250   * @see #get()
251   */
252  @Convenience
253  @OverridingDiscouraged
254  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
255    T value;
256    try {
257      value = this.get();
258    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
259      return;
260    }
261    action.accept(value);
262  }
263
264  /**
265   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
266   * on the supplied {@code presentAction} with the return value of an
267   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
268   * null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates value absence
269   * by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
270   * UnsupportedOperationException}, invokes the {@link Runnable#run()
271   * run()} method of the supplied {@code absentAction} instead.
272   *
273   * @param presentAction the {@link Consumer} representing the action
274   * to take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
275   *
276   * @param absentAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action
277   * to take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
278   *
279   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
280   * absentAction} is {@code null}
281   *
282   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
283   * determinism.
284   *
285   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
286   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
287   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
288   * accept(Object)} method may not be and the supplied {@link
289   * Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run() run()} method may not be
290   *
291   * @see #get()
292   */
293  @Convenience
294  @OverridingDiscouraged
295  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> presentAction, final Runnable absentAction) {
296    T value;
297    try {
298      value = this.get();
299    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
300      try {
301        absentAction.run();
302        return;
303      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
304        r.addSuppressed(e);
305        throw r;
306      }
307    }
308    presentAction.accept(value);
309  }
310
311  /**
312   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
313   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
314   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
315   *
316   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
317   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
318   *
319   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
320   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
321   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
322   * Optional} in these cases, which may not be valid for some use
323   * cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory absence, potential
324   * callers should use the {@link #get()} method directly or either
325   * the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link #optional(BiFunction)}
326   * methods.</p>
327   *
328   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
329   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
330   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
331   *
332   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not,
333   * and its (discouraged) overrides must not, return {@code null}.
334   *
335   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is, and
336   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by
337   * multiple threads.
338   *
339   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
340   * determinism.
341   *
342   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
343   *
344   * @see #get()
345   */
346  @Convenience
347  @OverridingDiscouraged
348  public default Optional<T> optional() {
349    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
350  }
351
352  /**
353   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
354   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
355   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
356   * result.
357   *
358   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
359   *
360   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
361   *
362   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
363   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
364   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
365   * supplied {@code handler}
366   *
367   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
368   * null}
369   *
370   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
371   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
372   *
373   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
374   * determinism.
375   *
376   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
377   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
378   *
379   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
380   *
381   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
382   */
383  @Convenience
384  @OverridingDiscouraged
385  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
386    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
387  }
388
389  /**
390   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
391   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
392   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
393   * result.
394   *
395   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
396   *
397   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
398   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
399   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
400   * with the supplied {@code handler}
401   *
402   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
403   * null}
404   *
405   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
406   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
407   *
408   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
409   * determinism.
410   *
411   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
412   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
413   *
414   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
415   *
416   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
417   */
418  @Convenience
419  @OverridingDiscouraged
420  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
421    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
422  }
423
424  /**
425   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
426   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
427   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
428   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
429   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}.
430   *
431   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
432   *
433   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
434   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
435   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
436   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
437   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}
438   *
439   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
440   * return {@code null}.
441   *
442   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
443   * determinism.
444   *
445   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
446   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
447   *
448   * @see #get()
449   */
450  @Convenience
451  @OverridingDiscouraged
452  public default T orElse(final T other) {
453    try {
454      return this.get();
455    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
456      return other;
457    }
458  }
459
460  /**
461   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
462   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
463   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
464   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
465   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
466   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}.
467   *
468   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
469   * {@code null}
470   *
471   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
472   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
473   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
474   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
475   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
476   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}
477   *
478   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
479   * null}
480   *
481   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
482   * return {@code null}.
483   *
484   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
485   * determinism.
486   *
487   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
488   * msut be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
489   * {@link Supplier#get() get()} method of the supplied {@code supplier}
490   * may not be
491   *
492   * @see #get()
493   */
494  @Convenience
495  @OverridingDiscouraged
496  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
497    try {
498      return this.get();
499    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
500      try {
501        return supplier.get();
502      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
503        r.addSuppressed(e);
504        throw r;
505      }
506    }
507  }
508
509  /**
510   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
511   * may be {@code null}.
512   *
513   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
514   * may be {@code null}
515   *
516   * @exception NoSuchElementException if value absence was indicated
517   * by the {@link #get()} method
518   *
519   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
520   * return {@code null}.
521   *
522   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
523   * determinism.
524   *
525   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
526   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
527   *
528   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
529   */
530  @Convenience
531  @OverridingDiscouraged
532  public default T orElseThrow() {
533    try {
534      return this.get();
535    } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException e) {
536      throw new NoSuchElementException(e.getMessage(), e);
537    }
538  }
539
540  /**
541   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
542   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
543   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
544   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
545   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
546   * Supplier#get() get()} method.
547   *
548   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
549   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
550   *
551   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
552   * must not be {@code null}
553   *
554   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
555   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
556   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
557   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
558   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
559   * Supplier#get() get()} method
560   *
561   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
562   * null}
563   *
564   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link #get()} method
565   * throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
566   * UnsupportedOperationException}
567   *
568   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
569   * return {@code null}.
570   *
571   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
572   * determinism.
573   *
574   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
575   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
576   *
577   * @see #get()
578   */
579  @Convenience
580  @OverridingDiscouraged
581  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
582    try {
583      return this.get();
584    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
585      final X throwable = throwableSupplier.get();
586      if (throwable.getCause() == null) {
587        throwable.initCause(e);
588      } else {
589        throwable.addSuppressed(e);
590      }
591      throw throwable;
592    }
593  }
594
595  /**
596   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
597   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
598   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
599   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
600   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
601   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
602   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method.
603   *
604   * <p>Note that this means the sole element of the {@link Stream}
605   * that is returned may be {@code null}.  If this is undesirable,
606   * consider invoking {@link Optional#stream() stream()} on the
607   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method instead.</p>
608   *
609   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
610   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
611   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
612   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
613   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
614   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
615   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method
616   *
617   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
618   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
619   *
620   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
621   * determinism.
622   *
623   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
624   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
625   *
626   * @see #get()
627   */
628  @Convenience
629  @OverridingDiscouraged
630  public default Stream<T> stream() {
631    try {
632      return Stream.of(this.get());
633    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
634      return Stream.empty();
635    }
636  }
637
638  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
639    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
640      return null;
641    } else {
642      throw e;
643    }
644  }
645
646}
